DataElement.preferredDefinition: An explanation that describes why plerixafor was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A bicyclam with hematopoietic stem cell-mobilizing activity. Plerixafor blocks the binding of stromal cell-derived factor (SDF-1alpha) to the cellular receptor CXCR4, resulting in hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) release from bone marrow and HSC movement into the peripheral circulation._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A bicyclam with hematopoietic stem cell-mobilizing activity. Plerixafor blocks the binding of stromal cell-derived factor (SDF-1alpha) to the cellular receptor CXCR4, resulting in hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) release from bone marrow and HSC movement into the peripheral circulation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

PermissibleValues.value: Recipient at risk of mobilization failure
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Mobilization Failure Risk

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Mobilization Failure Risk
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The recruitment of hematopoietic stem cells from the bone marrow into peripheral blood.: A lack of occurrence or performance.: The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
